name: Adaptability
desc: This Pokémon's STAB is increased by +1 at all levels.

name: Aftermath
desc: This Pokémon deals damage to an attacker equal to half of the damage received when knocked out by a melee move.

name: Air Lock
desc: While this Pokémon is in battle, weather-related abilities have no effect on the Pokémon that have them.

name: Air Slash
desc: This Pokémon knows Air Slash as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

name: Analytic
desc: After this Pokémon misses an attack, its next attack is done at advantage.

name: Anger Point
desc: After suffering a critical hit, this Pokémon adds proficiency to its damage if its next attack hits.

name: Anticipation
desc: When this Pokémon enters the battle, an opponent must reveal if it has a move that the Pokémon is vulnerable to. The move does not have to be revealed - only that there is such a move.

name: Aqua Camoflauge
desc: Once per short rest, this Pokémon gains temporary hit points equal to its level when battling in coastal and swampy areas, or in rainy conditions.

name: Arena Trap
desc: Wild Pokémon cannot flee from this Pokémon if it is active in battle, except if they are flying-type, or use the Levitate ability,.

name: Bad Dreams
desc: If an opponent in battle with this Pokémon falls asleep, they take an amount of damage equal to this Pokémon's proficeincy bonus at the end of each of their turns.

name: Battle Armor
desc: This Pokémon is immune to extra damage dealt by a Critical Hit.

name: Big Pecks
desc: This Pokémon's AC cannot be reduced by an opponent's moves.

name: Blaze
desc: When this Pokémon falls below 25% of its maximum HP, double the STAB damage for its fire-type moves.

name: Blizzard
desc: This Pokémon knows Blizzard as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

name: Burrower
desc: This Pokémon can burrow underground traveling a distance equal to its walking speed before re-emerging.

name: Cacophony
desc: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.

name: Chlorophyll
desc: This Pokémon’s speed is doubled in bright sunlight.

name: Clear Body
desc: Other Pokémon's moves or abilities cannot lower this Pokémon stats.

name: Cloud Nine
desc: While this Pokémon is in battle, weather-related abilities have no effect on the Pokémon that have them.

name: Color Change
desc: When hit by a damaging attack, this Pokémon's type changes to the type that hit it. It takes on the new type's resistances, vulnerabilities, and immunities.

name: Competitive
desc: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage rolls while poisoned, burned, confused, or paralyzed.

name: Compound Eyes
desc: This Pokémon gets an additional +1 to attack rolls.

name: Contrary
desc: Moves that affect this Pokémon's stats have the opposite effect. (For example, Defense Curl would lower AC by 4. Growl would increase its attack by +1)

name: Cursed Body
desc: When hit by a melee attack, this Pokémon may roll 1d4. On a result of 4, the opponent who made the attack cannot use the same move on its next turn.

name: Cute Charm
desc: Once per short rest, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy attack roll of your choice.

name: Damp
desc: This Pokémon is unaffected by Self Destruct and Explosion moves.

name: Defeatist
desc: When this Pokémon drops below 25% of its maximum HP, all of its attacks are rolled with disadvantage.

name: Defiant
desc: When this Pokémon is subject to a move that gives it a status condition, it has advantage on the next attack.

name: Download
desc: Once per short rest, this Pokémon can choose a different damage type for one of their normal attacks.

name: Drizzle
desc: A constant light rain forms on the battlefield when the Pokémon enters into combat. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.

name: Drought
desc: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to bright sunlight. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.

name: Dry Skin
desc: At the end of each of this Pokémon's turns, it takes an amount of damage equal to its proficiency modifier in strong sunlight, or heals for the same amount during rain.

name: Early Bird
desc: This Pokémon has advantage on rolls to wake from sleep.

name: Effect Spore
desc: When hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of grass damage equal to your proficiency modifier to your attacker.

name: Filter
desc: When hit by a move type this Pokémon is vulnerable to, it may roll a d4. In a result of 4, it does not take the additional damage.

name: Flame Body
desc: The flames from this Pokémon's body shine dim light in a 15 ft radius. In addition, when hit by a melee attack, roll a d10. On a 10, the attacker is burned.

name: Flare Boost
desc: This Pokémon adds proficiency to its damage rolls while burned.

name: Flash Fire
desc: This Pokémon takes no damage from fire. Instead, immediately after taking a hit from a fire-type move, or in open flames, double the STAB bonus on the next fire-type move.

name: Flower Gift
desc: During strong sunlight, ally Pokémon within 30 feet of this Pokémon add their proficiency bonus to damage rolls.

name: Forecast
desc: This Pokémon changes form with the weather. In rain it becomes water-type, in bright sun it becomes fire-type, in cold and snowy conditions it becomes ice-type. In all other conditions it is normal-type. Its STAB, resistance, immunities, and vulnerabilities change to match the form it takes.v

name: Forewarn
desc: When this Pokémon enters battle, it selects a target to reveal the move it knows with the most damage output. In the case of a tie, the target can choose which move it reveals.

name: Friend Guard
desc: Once per long rest, when an ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is hit by an attack, it may choose to halve the damage dealt.

name: Frisk
desc: Upon entering a battle, a single opponent’s held item is revealed, if it has one.

name: Gluttony
desc: This Pokémon must eat its held berry when it falls below ½ of its maximum HP.

name: Guts
desc: When this Pokémon is burned or poisoned, they are not affected by the disadvantage or half damage effects. They still take damage at the end of each of their turns.

name: Harvest
desc: At the end of this Pokémon's turn, if it used a berry, roll 1d4. On a result of 3 or 4, it regains that berry as a held item.

name: Healer
desc: As an action, this Pokémon can touch an ally to restore a negative status effect.

name: Healing Rain
desc: This Pokémon can use its action to heal hit points equal to its level, in rainy conditions.

name: Heatproof
desc: This Pokémon takes quarter damage from fire-type moves and is immune to the burning condition.

name: Heavy Metal
desc: This Pokémon is especially heavy. Once per long rest, after being targeted by an attack, it may increase its AC by 2 if it would cause an attack to miss.

name: Honey Gather
desc: At the end of each battle, this Pokémon may roll a d20. On a result of 20, its trainer adds a Honey to its inventory.

name: Huge Power
desc: Once per short rest, this Pokémon may double the damage it does on a single move that requires an attack roll. The player must announce that they are using this ability before the attack roll.

name: Hustle
desc: When this Pokémon scores a critical hit, it may immediately use the same move to attack again at disadvantage.

name: Hydration
desc: This Pokémon is unaffected by negative status ailments in water or during rainy conditions.

name: Hydro Pump
desc: This Pokémon knows Hydro Pump as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

name: Hyper Cutter
desc: This Pokémon’s ability modifiers cannot be decreased by an opponent’s moves.

name: Ice Body
desc: While it is snowing or hailing, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency modifier at the end of each of its turns.

name: Illuminate
desc: This Pokémon knows the "Light" cantrip and can cast it at will.

name: Illusion
desc: Once per long rest, this Pokémon can take the visual form of any Pokémon it can see. This illusion lasts for one minute, or until the Pokémon is hit by a damaging move.

name: Immunity
desc: This Pokémon is immune to becoming poisoned.

name: Imposter
desc: This Pokémon can use Transform as a bonus action.

name: Infiltrator
desc: This Pokémon bypasses Light Screen and Reflect.

name: Inner Focus
desc: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.

name: Insomnia
desc: This Pokémon is immune to sleep.

name: Intimidate
desc: Once per short rest, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy attack roll of your choice.

name: Iron Barbs
desc: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, it may roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of normal damage equal to its proficiency modifier to its attacker.

name: Iron Fist
desc: When attacking with a punch-based move (Mega Punch, Dynamic Punch, Ice/Fire/Thunder Punch, etc.), this Pokémon may roll the damage twice and take the higher result.

name: Justified
desc: When this Pokémon is hit by a dark-type move, it gets advantage on its next attack.

name: Keen Eye
desc: This Pokémon ignores disadvantage when it relates to sight.

name: Klutz
desc: This Pokémon cannot hold an item.

name: Leaf Guard
desc: This Pokémon does not suffer from any negative status ailments in bright sunlight.

name: Leaf Storm
desc: This Pokémon knows Leaf Storm as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

name: Levitate
desc: This Pokémon is immune to ground moves.

name: Light Metal
desc: This Pokémon is especially light for its species. Once per long rest, it may impose disadvantage on an attack roll against it.

name: Lightning Rod
desc: If an ally within 30 feet is attacked with an electric type move, this Pokémon can choose to use a reaction to redirect that attack to themselves instead. This does not work on area of effect moves.

name: Limber
desc: This Pokémon is immune to being paralyzed.

name: Liquid Ooze
desc: If an enemy uses a leeching or absorb move against this Pokémon, the Pokémon must make a DC 12 CON save or become poisoned.

name: Magic Bounce
desc: Once per long rest, when succumbing to a negative status effect, this Pokémon can instead reflect the effect back on the attacker.

name: Magic Guard
desc: If this Pokémon is subjected to a move that forces it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage on a success.

name: Magma Armor
desc: This Pokémon is immune to freezing.

name: Magnet Pull
desc: Steel opponents in battle with this Pokémon may not switch out or flee.

name: Marvel Scale
desc: This Pokémon's AC increase by 2 when suffering from a negative status condition.

name: Minus
desc: This Pokémon boosts its attack and damage rolls by 2 if an ally also has a Plus or Minus ability

name: Mold Breaker
desc: This Pokémon's moves ignore any abilities or moves that would lessen their effect  or ability to hit an opponent (Due to things like Water Absorb, Snow Cloak, Thick Fat, etc.)

name: Moody
desc: At the end of each long rest, this Pokémon rerolls on the nature table, replacing its nature with the result until the next long rest.

name: Motor Drive
desc: When hit by an electric-type move, if not immune, this Pokémon's speed increases by 10 feet until the end of combat (up to a max of 50 additional feet).

name: Moxie
desc: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon may immediately take another action.

name: Multiscale
desc: If this Pokémon is at full health, the first attack that hits it deals half damage.

name: Multitype
desc: This Pokémon's type and form change to match the type of Elemental Plate this Pokémon holds. The Plate cannot be effected by any item-removing ability or move.

name: Mummy
desc: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, one random ability of its attacker changes to Mummy until the remainder of the encounter.

name: Natural Cure
desc: This Pokémon is cured of negative status ailments upon returning to its Pokeball.

name: No Guard
desc: Any attack made by or against this Pokémon has advantage.

name: Normalize
desc: Every move this Pokémon makes is Normal type.

name: Oblivious
desc: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.

name: Overcoat
desc: This Pokémon does not take damage from weather-related moves like Hail, Weather Ball, etc.

name: Overgrow
desc: When this Pokémon falls below 25% of its maximum HP, double the STAB damage for its grass-type moves.

name: Overheat
desc: This Pokémon knows Overheat as a fifth move. The move is forgotten if it takes any other form.

name: Own Tempo
desc: This Pokémon is immune to becoming confused.

name: Paper Thin
desc: This Pokémon always has a maximum HP of 1.

name: Pickpocket
desc: As a bonus action, this Pokémon can make a DEX check contested by the opponent’s WIS to attempt to steal a held item. After the first attempt, all other attempts against the same opponent are rolled at disadvantage.

name: Pickup
desc: If an opponent uses a consumable held item in battle, this Pokémon gains a copy of it if it is not currently holding an item.

name: Plus
desc: This Pokémon boosts its attack and damage rolls by 2 if an ally also has a Plus or Minus ability

name: Poison Heal
desc: If this Pokémon is poisoned, the amount of damage dealt by the poison heals the Pokémon instead.

name: Poison Point
desc: On melee attacks made by this Pokémon, roll a d10 on a hit. On a result of a 10, the target is poisoned.

name: Poison Touch
desc: When this Pokémon is hit with a melee attack, roll a 1d4. On a result of 4, the attacker takes an amount of poison damage equal to this Pokémon’s proficiency modifier.

name: Prankster
desc: Once per short rest, this Pokémon can move to the top of initiative order in a single round, but must use a status-affecting move on its turn.

name: Pressure
desc: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly costs an additional 1 PP.

name: Protean
desc: This Pokémon's type changes to the type of move it uses, just before the move is used. It takes on the new type's resistances, vulnerabilities, and immunities.

name: Pure Power
desc: Once per short rest, this Pokémon may double the damage it does on a single move that requires an attack roll. The player must announce that they are using this ability before the attack roll.

name: Quick Feet
desc: When suffering from a negative status condition, this Pokémon’s speed increases by 15 ft.

name: Rain Dish
desc: In rainy conditions, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency bonus at the end of each of its turns.

name: Rattled
desc: When this Pokémon is hit by a damaging Dark, Bug, or Ghost move, it makes its next attack at advantage.

name: Reckless
desc: When attacking with moves with recoil damage, this Pokémon doubles its STAB bonus.

name: Regenerator
desc: Once per long rest, this Pokémon regains hit points equal to its level when it returns to its Pokéball.

name: Rivalry
desc: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage when attacking a Pokémon of the same type.

name: Rock Head
desc: This Pokémon takes no recoil damage.

name: Rough Skin
desc: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, it may roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of normal damage equal to its proficiency modifier to its attacker.

name: Run Away
desc: While this Pokémon is active, the trainer automatically succeeds on their DEX roll to run away from a wild Pokémon encounter.

name: Sand Force
desc: During a Sandstorm, this Pokémon can double its STAB when it hits an opponent.

name: Sand Rush
desc: This Pokémon’s speed is doubled in desert terrain, or during a Sandstorm.

name: Sand Stream
desc: A constant Sandstorm covers the battlefield when this Pokémon enters a battle. This Pokémon may use the move Sandstorm as a bonus action. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.

name: Sand Veil
desc: This Pokémon’s AC increases by 2 in desert terrain, or during a Sandstorm.

name: Sap Sipper
desc: This Pokémon is immune to grass-type moves. If hit by a grass type move, it takes no damage and instead absorbs the energy, granting advantage on its next attack.

name: Scrappy
desc: This Pokémon's Normal and Fighting type moves hit Ghost type Pokémon.

name: Serene Grace
desc: The DC to avoid a negative status condition from this Pokémon is increased by 1.

name: Shadow Tag
desc: If this Pokémon is active, an opponent cannot flee or be switched out.

name: Shed Skin
desc: If this Pokémon is affected by a negative status ailment, they can roll a d4 at the end of each of their turns. On a result of 4, they are cured.

name: Sheer Force
desc: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage rolls while poisoned, burned, confused, or paralyzed.

name: Shell Armor
desc: This Pokémon is immune to extra damage dealt by a Critical Hit.

name: Shield Dust
desc: Once per long rest, this Pokémon can ignore a negative status condition that results from an enemy move.

name: Simple
desc: Once per short rest, you may double this Pokémon's Move modifier for a single attack or damage roll.

name: Skill Link
desc: On combo moves like Fury Swipes, Comet Punch, etc., this Pokémon is guaranteed to hit at least twice.

name: Slow Start
desc: This Pokémon's speed is halved and its attacks are made at disadvantage for the first two rounds of every combat.

name: Slush Rush
desc: This Pokémon’s speed is doubled in arctic conditions, or during a hailstorm.

name: Sniper
desc: On a critical hit made by this Pokémon, triple the dice roll instead of doubling it.

name: Snow Cloak
desc: This Pokémon's AC is increased by 2 in arctic conditions, or when it is snowing or hailing.

name: Snow Warning
desc: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to hail. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.

name: Solar Power
desc: Damage rolls for this Pokémon get an additional +2 during bright sunlight.

name: Solid Rock
desc: This Pokémon does not take any additional damage from a critical hit.

name: Soundproof
desc: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.

name: Speed Boost
desc: While this Pokémon is active and in an environment related to its type (DM Discretion), its trainer gets advantage on initiative rolls.

name: Stall
desc: This Pokémon is always last in initiative order.

name: Static
desc: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a result of 4, the attacker takes an amount of electric damage equal to this Pokemon's proficiency bonus.

name: Steadfast
desc: Once per long rest, when this Pokémon fails a saving throw against a negative status condition, it can choose to pass instead.

name: Stench
desc: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, roll a d10. On a 10, the attacker flinches.

name: Sticky Hold
desc: Held items cannot be stolen or knocked away from this Pokémon.

name: Stone Veil
desc: This Pokémon's AC is increased by 2 in rocky terrain, or during a Sandstorm.

name: Storm Drain
desc: If an ally within 30 feet is attacked with a water type move, this Pokémon can use a reaction to choose to redirect that attack to themselves instead, gaining an amount of HP equal to half the damage dealt. This does not work on area of effect moves.

name: Sturdy
desc: When this Pokémon takes an amount of damage from a single hit that is equal or greater than half the Pokémon's maximum HP, the damage is halved.

name: Suction Cups
desc: This Pokémon cannot be forced out of battle by an opponent’s moves.

name: Super Luck
desc: This Pokémon increases its critical hit range by 1 (20 to 19+, etc.)

name: Swarm
desc: This Pokémon adds doubles its STAB bonus when it has 25% or less of its maximum health.

name: Swift Swim
desc: This Pokémon's swim speed is doubled in rainy conditions.

name: Synchronize
desc: If this Pokémon becomes burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, its attacker receives the negative status condition as well (if not immune).

name: Tangled Feet
desc: Attacks against this Pokémon have disadvantage when it is confused.

name: Technician
desc: For damaging moves activated by this Pokémon with 15 max PP or more, they may roll the damage twice and use the higher result.

name: Telepathy
desc: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.

name: Teravolt
desc: This Pokémon’s moves completely ignore any ability that would hinder or prevent their effect on the target or the user's ability to hit the target.

name: Thick Fat
desc: This Pokémon takes quarter damage from Fire and Ice type moves.

name: Tinted Lens
desc: This Pokémon’s moves ignore resistances.

name: Torrent
desc: When this Pokémon falls below 25% of its health, double the STAB damage for its water-type moves.

name: Toxic Boost
desc: When this Pokémon is hit by a poison-type attack, its next attack is rolled at advantage.

name: Trace
desc: This Pokémon copies a random ability of an opponent when entering battle. The ability cannot be Flower Gift, Forecast, Illusion, Imposter, Multitype, Trace, Wonder Guard, or Zen Mode.

name: Transformer
desc:
This Pokémon has a standard Normal form from which all stats are based, but may change forms as a bonus action to drastically change its abilities. The forms it can take are Attack, Defense, and Speed. 
- In Attack form, it adds an additional +5 to its attack rolls, but all attacks against it has advantage.
- In Defense form, its AC increases by 3, but its attacks are rolled at disadvantage. If the activated move requires a save, the target(s) have advantage.
- In Speed form, it gains an additional attack action each turn, but the attack is done at disadvantage. If it is a move that requires a save, the target(s) have advantage.

name: Truant
desc: This Pokémon cannot use the same move in back to back rounds.

name: Turboblaze
desc: This Pokémon’s moves completely ignore any ability that would hinder or prevent their effect on the target or the user's ability to hit the target.

name: Unaware
desc: When this Pokémon attacks an opponent, it ignores any stat boosts the opponent has been affected with since the start of battle. This includes boosts to AC or saving throws the Pokémon has to make.

name: Unburden
desc: While this Pokémon is active and not holding an item, its trainer gets advantage on initiative rolls.

name: Unnerve
desc: Opponents in combat with this Pokémon cannot eat held berries.

name: Victory Star
desc: While this Pokémon is in battle, all allied Pokémon add an additional +1 to their attack rolls.

name: Vital Spirit
desc: This Pokémon cannot be put to sleep.

name: Volt Absorb
desc: Electric type moves do not damage this Pokémon. Instead, half of any electric damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.

name: Water Absorb
desc: Water type moves do not damage this Pokémon. Instead, half of any water damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.

name: Water Veil
desc: This Pokémon is immune to burning.

name: Water Weight
desc: Once per short rest, this Pokémon gains temporary hit points equal to its level when battling in coastal and swampy areas, or in rainy conditions.

name: Weak Armor
desc: When an attack hits this Pokémon, its speed increases by 5 feet, but its AC is temporarily reduced by 1 until the end of battle (for a maximum reduction of -5).

name: White Smoke
desc: Other Pokémon's moves or abilities cannot lower this Pokémon stats.

name: Wonder Guard
desc: This Pokémon is immune to damaging attacks from types that are not in its vulnerabilities list.

name: Wonder Skin
desc: This Pokémon has advantage on all saving throws related to being burned, frozen, poisoned, or paralyzed.

name: Zen Mode
desc: When Darmanitan is below 50% of its HP, it enters Zen Mode. In Zen Mode, Darmanitan changes into the form of a solid statue. It's type changes to Fire/Psychic, it gains +4 to its AC, and its STR and WIS ability scores are swapped.
